inclusion.criterion: About affiliated to the social security
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Prior agreement with the patient signing a consent
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Antibiotic ongoing for more than 24 hours at the time of diagnosis of pulmonary embolism
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Cardiogenic shock (hypotension with mean arterial pressure less than 65 bpm)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Suspicion of infection other than lung associated (associated urinary tract infection, prostatitis, ENT infection, sinusitis ...)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 60-year-old woman admitted to the stroke department with a recent history of a second course of intravenous antibiotics for aspiration pneumonia. She is febrile and complained of abdominal pain and diarrhea (bowel movements eight times in 3 hours, large volumes of greenish, liquid stool each time).
